docs.snippet: A social media furor over data privacy on Indian political party apps escalated on Monday with the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party and opposition Indian National Congress trading barbs.

headline.print_headline: India's BJP, Congress Trade Barbs Over Data Privacy
headline.main: India's BJP, Congress Trade Barbs Over Data Privacy

docs.snippet: England need to learn some lessons, and fast, if they are to salvage a drawn two-test series against New Zealand after they emphatically lost the opener by an innings and 49 runs on Monday, captain Joe Root has said.

headline.print_headline: Final Day Fight Good but Lessons Need to Be Learned-Root
headline.main: Final Day Fight Good but Lessons Need to Be Learned-Root

docs.snippet: The semi-government agency behind India's national identity card project on Saturday denied a report by news website ZDNet that the program has been hit by another security lapse that allows access to private information.

headline.print_headline: Indian Agency Denies Reported Security Lapse in ID Card Project
headline.main: Indian Agency Denies Reported Security Lapse in ID Card Project

docs.snippet: The cuisine of India’s best-known chef, Sanjeev Kapoor, is being brought to California by a couple with no culinary experience but plenty of passion.

headline.print_headline: Fans of a Chef Go All In
headline.main: They Were Fans of the Chef. Now They Run His Restaurant.

docs.snippet: The world needs to reduce emissions to avoid drastic global warming. For now, a new study shows, we’re moving in the opposite direction.

headline.print_headline: Behind the Increase in Gas Emissions Last Year
headline.main: Greenhouse Gas Emissions Rose Last Year. Here Are the Top 5 Reasons.

docs.snippet: This week’s newsletter asks: Where is integration working in Australia, where is it failing? What do you see in your daily life that signals where the country’s multicultural effort is heading?

headline.print_headline: Get to Know Your Overqualified Uber or Ola Driver
headline.main: Get to Know Your Overqualified Uber or Ola Driver

docs.snippet: Sri Lanka's Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe faces a no- confidence motion on Wednesday that could go down to the wire and lead to political instability in the island nation, even if the government manages to scrape a win.

headline.print_headline: Sri Lanka's PM Faces Tight Confidence Vote as Key Ally Plans to Defect
headline.main: Sri Lanka's PM Faces Tight Confidence Vote as Key Ally Plans to Defect

docs.snippet: Four times world champion Lewis Hamilton is Britain's sole representative on the Formula One starting grid this season but it may not be long before the Mercedes driver is joined by another.

headline.print_headline: Trio of British F1 Reserve Drivers Lead F2 Rookie Charge
headline.main: Trio of British F1 Reserve Drivers Lead F2 Rookie Charge

docs.snippet: South Africa exorcised a long-standing hoodoo when they completed a comprehensive 3-1 home test series victory over Australia on Tuesday, winning the battle on and off the pitch to cement their place as the world's number two side behind India.

headline.print_headline: Du Plessis Delighted to Break Long Australia Jinx
headline.main: Du Plessis Delighted to Break Long Australia Jinx

docs.snippet: Asian share markets faltered on Wednesday as simmering fears of a Sino-U.S. trade war overshadowed a bounce on Wall Street and left investors reluctant to take positions in anything.

headline.print_headline: Asia Shares Fail to Bounce With Wall St. As Trade Fears Lurk
headline.main: Asia Shares Fail to Bounce With Wall St. As Trade Fears Lurk
